meanings.definition: The foremost part or place in a trend or movement.
meanings.sent1: She stood at the forefront of the protest, holding a sign.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the main character is always at the forefront of the action.
meanings.sent3: At the forefront of the dance competition, the clumsy cat tried to mimic the moves.
meanings.sent4: The new technology quickly moved to the forefront of the industry.
meanings.sent5: The bright red flag at the forefront of the parade caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The leading or most important position or role.
meanings.sent1: His dedication to his work put him at the forefront of the company.
meanings.sent2: The forefront of the meeting was reserved for the guest speaker.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow took the forefront in the choir performance.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness always brings her to the forefront of people's minds.
meanings.sent5: The forefront of the battle was where the bravest soldiers fought.
